headline: Blueberry Crumb Pie
description: This blueberry crumble pie is topped with a cinnamon-oat topping and can be made with fresh or frozen berries. This family-favorite recipe is so easy.
name: Blueberry Crumb Pie
recipeIngredient: 6 tablespoons cold unsalted butter, cut into pieces

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Make the pie: Press pie pastry into the bottom and up the sides of a 9-inch pie plate to form a crust.
Whisk sugar and flour together in a large bowl. Mix in lemon juice and zest, then gently stir in blueberries. Pour mixture into crust.

Make the topping: Combine oats, brown sugar, flour, and cinnamon in a medium bowl. Cut in cold butter with two knives or a pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Spread topping evenly over pie filling.
Bake in the preheated oven until filling is bubbly and topping is golden brown, about 40 minutes.
Remove from the oven and cool on a wire rack before serving.

review.reviewBody: My first blueberry pie and probably my last. I made this for Thanksgiving and was so disappointed. It wasn't sweet enough and really didn't look done. And way to much crunch on the top.

In all seriousness and honesty, I have to say this was one of the worst recipes I have ever tried. It simply came out of the oven (yes, after 40 min. at 375) with the blueberries tasting as though they were simply uncooked blueberries and with no juice whatsoever. And to top it off the oats in the topping just gave an unpleasant and annoying texture when chewing.
Followed the recipe but left out the lemon zest and added 1 tablespoon of corn starch because the berries were frozen. Delicious!!
Delicious! Easy pie to prepare and enjoy! Will definitely make again!!!

Great pie! I added the 1 Tb of cornstarch, and used 4 cups of large, fresh blueberries. The only change I'll make next time is I'll prebake the pie crust for 10 minutes before adding the filling, because the bottom didn't bake well and was soggy. That's all, though!
My first bite of this pie and I knew it was a winner. Amazing! I will for sure be making this again.
Absolutely delicious and easy to make pie! I forgot to add the extra flour to the filling mixture, and so it turned out. More like cobbler.

Made this today with fresh blueberries after watching the video; added a teaspoon of vanilla and substituted brown sugar in place of the white for the crumbled topping. Super easy, so good, about to make another.
This pie was nothing short of amazing! I used fresh picked blueberries and made it for the 4th. I cut sugar back from 2/3 c to 1/2 c in both the filling and crust and added 1T cornstarch.

While the overall flavor was good (I used lime instead of lemon because that is what I had. I also omitted the zest), the pie was way too sweet. Based on other reviews, I added 2T cornstarch to flour mixture, but it still came out super soupy. I won't be making this one again
Very delicious! Family loved the top of the pie. Adding this recipe to my collection! Thank you!!

Fabulous pie recipe. The lemon zest and juice add a brightness to the blueberries. Next time I’ll add the zest and juice after mixing in the blueberries so it doesn’t get clumpy. I also used 3 pints of blueberries and a 10”pie plate. It was soooo good eating warm out of the oven.
I had small frozen blueberries so took others advice and added 1 Tbsp of cornstarch to thicken which it did perfectly. Fantastic flavor. Am looking forward to making it again!
Delicious and easy recipe. Love the crumb topping.

I also had blueberry soup! I added 1 T. of cornstarch and evenly distributed the flour mixture. It also was cool when I cut it. It was better the following day after being refrigerated. It tasted good with ice cream, but I would not recommend this recipe. My grandmother’s 2 crust recipe oven temp is set for 425 for 10 minutes and then 375 for 30 minutes. My pie was bubbling over the edge.
The flavor is wonderful. Added 1 tablespoon cornstarch to the flour sugar mix. My pie crust was soggy though. Served it with a small scoop of vanilla ice cream.
Yum yum So good
This was great. We used fresh blueberries we picked today. Will definitely make again.

I made the recipe as written. It was far too sweet but I used freshly picked berries that were not tart at all. It also didn't set up well; we ate it when it was cool but it fell apart as it was served. After a night in the fridge the remainder was a little better set but not as I expected it should be. I've been mixing the remainder with plain greek yogurt for breakfast and that combo has been delicious. If I make this recipe again I'll reduce the sugar and add cornstarch like other reviewers.

blueberries did not burst so next time I will cook on the stove top and reduce them first. came out too watery, which may have also been caused by the amount of sugar that seems too much. I agree with another review that said the crumb topping was too thick so the second time I made this, I cut it in half and it was much better.
Made this for Christmas. My first ever blueberry pie turned out so good thanks to this recipe!
Easy to make and simply delicious. The perfect change up from your normal go to dessert. I used a combination of frozen and fresh blueberries. Leftovers? Have it for a breakfast treat
It was tasty, but soupy, maybe because I used frozen blueberries? I did thaw and drain excess juice off of them, but it still needed thickening.

Here's the recipe for the delicious Berry pie I made yesterday for my sister's Christmas party. Step 1: (Easy Peasy way) Basically I got a frozen already made crust I got from Trader Joe's. Step 2: I then mixed in a bowl 2 cups frozen blueberries, 1 1/2 cups cranberries, 1 1/2 cups froezen rasberries (basically 5 cups berries your choice) mixed in with 1/2 cup blue agave (I try to avoid sugar), 1/3 cup pastry wheat flour with 2 teaspoons lemon zest (I actually used extract which made it very tart) and 1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice. I also added 1 tablespoon corn starch (or you can use arrowroot) to thicken it (this will be needed as extra water will be created when the berries melt as one reviewer pointed out). Put this filling in the pie crust. Step 3: Follow the rest of the instructions in this recipie to add the crumb topping - I only used 1/2 cup brown sugar and used 3 tablespoons apple sauce and 3 tablespoons cannola oil. It tastes great either hot or cold. I tried it hot topped with whipped cream (see picture) which was really good - Enjoy!
I made this for a dinner party I was hosting and the reviews were mixed. Some people thought it was too lemony, some people liked it. I, personally, liked it. Made it as written.

I read other reviews and added a tablespoon of corn starch to make the filling less watery since I used frozen blueberries, but it still came out a bit watery. The other suggestion would be to reduce the sugar in the filling because it was way too sweet for my liking. I’m still going to eat it because it’s not bad but these are just a few of my tips that I’ll put to use next time .
Wife and daughter absolutely rave about this, one of the best I have ever had.

Loved this but it was a bit sweet for me. I added a 2-3cups more blueberries the second round and it was perfect for our tastes! Excellent flavor on the filling and crumble. Filling would be nice in a traditional pie crust and top as well.
I love this pie. I add a little corn starch to make it more firm and less juice but other than that the recipe is perfect. I make it many times every summer.
Made it with blueberries from our own garden. The pie looked so good. Tasted fresh, delicious. Served easily. I prefer the crumb top over a lattice top.
Best Blueberry Pie ever!!! The lemon makes it extra delicious.
This was absolutely delicious. Substituted Splenda for sugar and used Truvia brown sugar blend, because the spouse is diabetic. Turned out great!
The berries and sugar-flour mixture did not blend while it baked, and the bottom crust was not cooked. The result is a mushy, watery, gritty mess. PS it wasn't sweet enough, either.
I was very good and I got rave reviews and I would not change a thing
Excellent- people went back for seconds, thirds.
DELISH
The best blueberry pie I've ever made! Absolutely delicious!
Made it using an organic crust on bottom. Very delicious!! I will definitely make it again.

This is a keeper! Unique twist on a typical blueberry pie. Used frozen blueberries (thawed......will partially thaw the next time - they got pretty mushy), reduced both sugars (1/4 cup in the filling was great, and 1/2 cup in topping worked), and added 1 Tbl tapioca. Wonderful flavor!!!!
Delicious !!! Yes it was runny despite the draining of her frozen berries but after refrigerating it solidifies. Will definitely make again
Maybe the blueberries I used were too big, but 5 cups was WAY too much. I cut it down to 4 on the second one I made and was great!
I used 1 can of blueberry pie filling and 1 cup fresh blueberries (which I added less 1/4 c. sugar and 1/8 c. flour). Delicious!

Delicious! I changed to 10 servings to fit my 10-inch pie pan. I used frozen berries and added 3T of minute tapioca. But it was incredibly runny unless served right out of the refrigerator. Next time I will add more tapioca and/or cornstarch.

Definitely was a very tasty pie! Some changes that I made was, are used frozen blueberries but I took them out tonight before and sat them in a bowl with paper towel lined. Every day I switched out the paper towel to absorb the juiciness. Then, I added 2 tablespoons of corn starch and half a tablespoon of flour additional. made for a perfect consistency!!! The crumble was not as soft as I had hoped for, but it was definitely tasty!

Easy recipe especially if you used frozen pie shell. I always use frozen blueberries as I pick them in my yard at the lake and always have them to use. I never thaw them for pie or muffins. This recipe has plenty of thickener (flour). If you want more add a TBSP more to the berries before they go into the pie shell. Baked 1 hour. I would maybe use 4 1/2 berries next time so that there was more room for the crumble topping to lay flat on the pie. Mine had a swell in the middle so I had to be careful adding the topping as it rolled down. I put my hand along the edge as I was adding topping to prevent that. Fabulous. We ate it warm with vanilla ice cream. Rave reviews from my family. It’s gone..Yum.

This has to be the best and easiest blueberry pie ever. Yes, it takes 5 cups of berries but it is so good. I did add 1 tbsp of cornstarch as suggested by another reader- it make the pie easier to cut and serve.
Pie was delicious and SO easy to make. Family raved about how good it was. Will definitely make again.
Awesome recipe! Family loved it! Added bit of cinnamon to the berries...

This pie is AMAZING! We both love it; and I'm not big on fruit pies. I used blueberries fresh off the bushes. I had to use sucralose (Splenda) with the berries because of hubby's diabetes & my suspected pre-diabetes. The topping was made using the Splenda/brown sugar hybrid. I wonder how this pie would taste with real sugar! Probably 10 stars worth of tasty!

7.19.18 ... https://www.allrecipes.com/recipe/86150/blueberry-crumb-pie/ ... 'Using homegrown (juicy) & frozen berries, I increased flour to 1/2c. I didn't go with the lemon business, but I'm sure I'd like it, too. 'Thinking these juicy berries would cause a long term sounding of the smoke alarm, I only used 4c berries, not 5. Kudos to the submitter for not adding more sugar to the berries. Many add too much & the berry flavor is lost. The topping was good, but - & I mean this not to be a negative - kind of like a dry oatmeal cookie. It softened overnight, of course. Surprisingly with the right amount of sugar with the berries, the topping didn't sweeten it too much, but it didn't. Huh. :D Good, but I prefer regular ole pie crust. Thanks for sharing your recipe, MissBethany!
Yummy. I used some frozen raspberries I had on hand too. Very tasty. And actually made enough crumb to cover the top of the pie (many recipes don't)

Followed recipe exactly. Had gone blueberry picking so the success may be in part to the quality of the blueberries. I expected this recipe to be good, but it exceeded expectations. It was soooo very good. Will make again!
It was perfect, I didn't change anything , I use fresh blueberries. I though for the consistency fresh will be better than frozen.

I made this with frozen wild blueberries. What a waste!
Was curious how the pie would set up with no cornstarch and found out instead, how to make overly sweet, gritty, blue soup.
So disappointed!
Followed as directed. Came out nothing like the photo. Terrible recipe unless you like blueberry soup.

WAY too much sugar in this recipe. I would cut it to 1/4 cup of sugar. Also, after adding 1 1/2 tbsp cornstarch, it was still very runny. It would have been delicious if not so darn sweet! My husband wouldn't even have a second piece.

I'm not a fan of blueberries myself so I had to rely on my family's feedback. Turns out I will definitely make this again, they loved it. I also added 2 tbs of cornstarch as recommended and it seemed to work out well.

I'm not a fan of blueberries myself so I had to rely on my family's feedback. Turns out I will definitely make this again, they loved it. I also added 2 tbs of cornstarch as recommended and it seemed to work out well.

It was very good. Made it for company and they asked for seconds. I did use a reviewers advice and added 2TB of cornstarch. I did let the pie sit a few hours before serving and it was not runny. Also used fresh blueberries.
Bottom doesn't cook through. Made it exactly like the recipe, but used a regular glass pie pan, not deep, and it still came out undone on the bottom.
This recipe was easy to follow but the "crumb" topping was more like a paste. I thought it was supposed to come out like crumbs--it ended up being paste-y. Ugh!

This was my first time making this and it came out runny and not enough of a crumb topper. It taste good, but looking at it is another story. You could literally take a straw and drink some of the filling.

Definitely one of the best blueberry pies I've ever made. After reading the reviews, I made two changes. I added a tablespoon of cornstarch to flour-sugar-lemon mix, and I allowed the pie to sit for 24 hours before serving it. It turned out beautifully. My family loved it. I will definitely make this again!

I followed the recipe as written. It was absolutely delicious but I would make two changes. First of all the lemon juice should be added to the blueberries not the dry ingredients. If you add it to the dry ingredients it clumps up and is not spread evenly through the filling. I would also use instant tapioca instead of flour in the filling. It didn’t set up as it should have and I could still taste the flour.

This is a very easy recipe. I've made it twice, the first time in a 9" glass pie plate and the second in an 8" aluminum pan and reduced the recipe to 6 servings. I don't care for store bought pie crusts so I used Ina Garten's pie crust recipe (so easy and a winner every time). Both times
Best Blueberry Pie I've ever had!!!!

Made this as written but added one tablespoon of cornstarch. Turned out perfect!! I made this with blueberries fresh out of my yard. My husband and I thought it was the best blueberry pie we have tasted. By the way I have 5 blueberry bushes and will make again before summer is over. Thanks for sharing.
Excellent...

I added corn starch based on other reviews, but wish I hadn't. 

recipe makes more crumble than needed, probably more blueberries too. At least for my dish.
Delicious! I could use less sugar...but it was great as is.
Not too sweet and the crumb topping was great. My husband's favourite
I used 3 cups of frozen berries. I will definitely make the again!

The topping was the best part. This pie was very runny. Like blueberry soup. I followed the directions exact. I almost always use frozen blueberries, that's why I chose this recipe. Maybe I will have to make it again and see if it's any better.
Made only the topping and used premade crust and canned all natural blueberry pie filling. It was delicious!
Simple, easy and yummy
Absolutely wonderful new favorite in my house.
One of my families favorites. Only change is I bring blueberries, flour and sugar to boil on stoptop before cooking and the pie really firms up great!

I made this pie for Christmas and it was a hit. The pie was gone almost the moment it was time for dessert. I did add a extra half cup of sugar but beyond that I followed the recipe. I highly recommend this pie for any event.
I've made this many times, excellent. I sometimes add chopped walnuts for extra crunch and flavor.

I made two changes to this recipe. I baked the pie crust for 10 minutes at 450 degrees before adding the filling and then I added 2 tablessoons of Kraft minute Tapioca to the filling .Comes out Perfect every time! Crust is not soggy and pie filling is not runny

This is so delicious and easy to make. As recommended I added 1Tbsp cornstarch and it turned out prefect. I recommend using fresh blueberries as I did. Will be making more of this, and as the blueberries season coming to a closed, using frozen will have to due on that note... make sure your frozen blueberries are completely thawed out & drained. Also add 2Tbsp of cornstarch for frozen blueberries instead.

Excellent recipe. Made it as recipe reads, except added 2 tbs. cornstarch, and blind-baked the crust for about 10 minutes, covering the edges with tin foil (I used frozen deep dish pie crust). Refrigerated the pie after it cooled a bit. After a few hous of chilling it still bled a bit, but nothing terrible, it was still juicy. Excellent with our homemade peach ice cream. Crumble on top was nice and crispy, good texture . Definitely will make this again.

LOVE this pie!! Made it a few times already and it's always a hit! I have always made the recipe just as it's written here but the only difference is I usually bake it for about an hour instead of the recommended 40 minutes to ensure the top is browned nicely. Just keep an eye on it after the 40 minute mark and pull it out once the top is nice and crispy
should have read the reviews first needed a deep dish pie crust the sauce was like soup should have added tapioca to thicken it crust got hard the next day.

Made as written - when preparing the filling, I used a pastry cutter to cut in the lemon zest/lemon juice into the sugar and flour before adding the rinsed, patted dry, fresh blueberries. Not sure if this prevented the soggy crust that some encountered. This was a big hit with guests and I will definitely make again.
So, so very good. I used coconut sugar instead of regular sugar and it was great. You don't even need to bottom crust...

Fast and delicious! Used thawed frozen blueberries, added two T. more flour as others suggested. Perfectly-set filling. The topping gives it a nice crunch. I don't usually add cinnamon to berry pie, but threw caution to the winds and am glad I did. Will make again.

Intact, seemingly uncooked blueberries tumbled out onto the plate in a puddle of liquid when I served this! The pie definitely needed more time in the oven so the filling could gelatinize and the berries soften. I would make it again; however, I'd bake it longer in order to thicken the filling (and actually cook and soften the berries). I'll try it again just to see if it works!
Has good flavor, but very runny even with 1.5 tbs cornstarch. This is a keeper and can def be modified to perfection!

Terrific pie! Much more exciting than a normal 2 crust blueberry pie. The entire family LOVED it! I'm not sure that I can pick enough blueberries to keep up with demands for this pie. I wouldn't change a single thing.
Turned out great! I added cornstarch to the blueberries and some water. Cooked them on the stove for a few minutes to soften them. My hubby's new fav pie! Thanks!

I found the crumble topping was enough for two pies. The pie itself was a bit runny. That could have been a result of using wonderfully large blueberries from California. I may add a bit more flower to the blueberry mix next time. All in all I gave the pie a 5 star as it was very delicious. Thanks for the recipe. I will definitely make this again. Many times over in fact.
It was very good but a little runny

This was absolutely yummy! Even family members that don't like blueberry pie tried it and ended up eating it all! I used canned blueberries as the market was out of fresh berries, added lemon juice (didn't have lemon zest so left that part out) and finished off with the topping as directed. I will definitely be making this again!

I made this for a family get-together. My brother loved it so much that he ate three slices! I suppose that means I'll be making this again! 

I squeezed my own lemon juice, which I think gives a truer lemon flavor (it's less tart than the concentrate.) I also added 1 tablespoon of cornstarch to the filling dry ingredients before adding the blueberries. Next time I will try 1 1/2 tablespoons because it was still slightly running. 

Our store was out of fresh blueberries so we used frozen. I forgot to thaw them overnight so I put them in a colander and lowered it into cold water for 5 minutes to thaw. Then I let them drain and patted them with a few paper towels. 

Love this recipe. Will be making it again but may need to make two pies next time!

I make my own Sangria ( Blueberries, raspberries and blackberries)and am always looking for ways to use the left over fruit. I substituted the triple berry mix ( left over after I drank the Sangria) for the blueberries and it made an awesome pie. My friends can't get enough
Tastes more like a cobbler than a pie but is still very good.
I made this after picking some fresh blueberries. My husband was almost in tears. The kids don't like blueberries- all the more for us.

This is AMAZING....and truth be told, I'm a horrible cook. One suggestion, don't leave out the lemon juice or zest. I have also made gluten-free version with gluten free oatmeal and premade gluten free pie crust, with Pillsbury Gluten multi-purpose gluten free flour blend and I can't tell a difference. I have not had a problem with it being "overly wet". With the suggestion of another reviewer from Grandma Ople's Apple pie, I now always use a pizza stone- not sure if that helps or not. Now giving this to neighbors as xmas gifts. Thanks for the recipe! By the way, it was so good, this was my first review--I loved it that much.
